entry.title: International arbitrators order Armenia to halt utility seizure: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: International arbitrators order Armenia to halt utility seizure: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìçArbitrators ordered Armenia to halt its seizure of the country‚Äôs power grid, arguing the nationalization of Electric Networks of Armenia would violate an international investment treaty. Armenia‚Äôs justice minister suggested the country may defy the decision. üìçGlobal ratings agency Fitch affirmed Armenia‚Äôs ‚ÄúBB-‚Äù sovereign credit rating with a stable outlook.

entry.title: Meghri: The Armenia Project interns explore south Armenia with CivilNet

media:group.media:title: Meghri: The Armenia Project interns explore south Armenia with CivilNet
media:group.media:description:
The Armenia Project interns traveled to Syunik province to meet with residents and learn about life in Kapan, which borders Azerbaijan, and Meghri, which borders Iran.

entry.title: Armenia declined U.S. land lease proposal in Syunik

media:group.media:title: Armenia declined U.S. land lease proposal in Syunik
media:group.media:description:
üìçA senior lawmaker from Armenia‚Äôs ruling Civil Contract party confirmed the U.S. proposal to lease a strip of land in Syunik province, and said Yerevan ultimately found it unacceptable due to sovereignty concerns. üìçReacting to the discussions over the U.S. involvement in the normalization between Armenia and Azerbaijan, the Kremlin said it is the sovereign right of the two countries, but accused Washington of ‚Äúdeception.‚Äù üìçThe Armenian government approved a new procedure for developing and adopting urban planning technical regulations, aiming to bring national construction norms closer with those of the European Union.

media:group.media:title: U.S. eyes Syunik road solution
media:group.media:description:
üìçEighty-seven members of the U.S. Congress sent a bipartisan letter to Secretary of State Marco Rubio, urging the Trump administration to support the safe, dignified, and voluntary return of Armenians displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçThe U.S proposal on the Syunik transit route is not a detailed plan but a general concept so far, Olesya Vartanyan, a conflict resolution and security professional, said in an interview with CivilNet. üìçThe SCC Arbitration Institute in Stockholm, which ordered the Armenian government to halt its nationalization efforts against the Electricity Networks of Armenia (ENA), has explicitly barred authorities from changing the company‚Äôs management, appointing a temporary administrator, or interfering in its operations.

entry.title: Pashinyan approval slides amid church clash

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan approval slides amid church clash
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian unpacks the results from the most recent polling by the International‚ÄØRepublican‚ÄØInstitute. The results of the survey show that 61% of respondents trust no politician and they also highlight shrinking support for Pashinyan after his clash with the church.
